column5: Ok the ice is gone on Lake in the Woods area. So how does the walleye bite look for opening weekend May 16 on Lake in the Woods. Are we mostly pre-spawn or post-spawn or SOL? If we fall into the 3rd category what is the back up plan? Search for Trout or Pike or ??? Thanks B-

The weather is so nice, they should be just finishing up their spawn. They'll still be shallow though. Of course, we're still a week out, and it was very cold today... that might slow them down though.
I have water temps in the low 40s and it did in fact snow today. Bitterly cold and cold weather for the next few days. Won't warm up until late next week. Going to be close.
Sand bays with rock, rip/rap and ideally weeds should be a home run (in my experience).
You've got me worried that my unit's temp isn't working. Mine has been reading in the 50's all week.
We are a bit colder than LOW. A depth of 440 feet doesn't help water temps much this time of year.
